verses.verse: Now Sarai<WH8297> Abram's<WH87> wife<WH802> bore him no children:<WH3205> <WH3808> and she had an handmaid,<WH8198> an Egyptian,<WH4713> whose name<WH8034> was Hagar.<WH1904>

And Sarai<WH8297> said<WH559> unto<WH413> Abram,<WH87> Behold<WH2009> now,<WH4994> the LORD<WH3068> hath restrained<WH6113> me from bearing:<WH4480> <WH3205> I pray thee,<WH4994> go in<WH935> unto<WH413> my maid;<WH8198> it may be<WH194> that I may obtain children<WH1129> by<WH4480> her. And Abram<WH87> hearkened<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of Sarai.<WH8297>

And Sarai<WH8297> Abram's<WH87> wife<WH802> took<WH3947> <WH853> Hagar<WH1904> her maid<WH8198> the Egyptian,<WH4713> after<WH4480> <WH7093> Abram<WH87> had dwelt<WH3427> ten<WH6235> years<WH8141> in the land<WH776> of Canaan,<WH3667> and gave<WH5414> her to her husband<WH376> Abram<WH87> to be his wife.<WH802>

And he went in<WH935> unto<WH413> Hagar,<WH1904> and she conceived:<WH2029> and when she saw<WH7200> that<WH3588> she had conceived,<WH2029> her mistress<WH1404> was despised<WH7043> in her eyes.<WH5869>

And Sarai<WH8297> said<WH559> unto<WH413> Abram,<WH87> My wrong<WH2555> be upon<WH5921> thee: I<WH595> have given<WH5414> my maid<WH8198> into thy bosom;<WH2436> and when she saw<WH7200> that<WH3588> she had conceived,<WH2029> I was despised<WH7043> in her eyes:<WH5869> the LORD<WH3068> judge<WH8199> between<WH996> me and thee.

But Abram<WH87> said<WH559> unto<WH413> Sarai,<WH8297> Behold,<WH2009> thy maid<WH8198> is in thy hand;<WH3027> do<WH6213> to her as it pleaseth<WH2896> <WH5869> thee. And when Sarai<WH8297> dealt hardly<WH6031> with her, she fled<WH1272> from her face.<WH4480> <WH6440>

And the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> found<WH4672> her by<WH5921> a fountain<WH5869> of water<WH4325> in the wilderness,<WH4057> by<WH5921> the fountain<WH5869> in the way<WH1870> to Shur.<WH7793>

And he said,<WH559> Hagar,<WH1904> Sarai's<WH8297> maid,<WH8198> whence<WH335> <WH4480> <WH2088> camest<WH935> thou? and whither<WH575> wilt thou go?<WH1980> And she said,<WH559> I<WH595> flee<WH1272> from the face<WH4480> <WH6440> of my mistress<WH1404> Sarai.<WH8297>
And the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto her, Return<WH7725> to<WH413> thy mistress,<WH1404> and submit thyself<WH6031> under<WH8478> her hands.<WH3027>

And the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto her, I will multiply thy seed exceedingly,<WH7235> <WH7235> <WH853> <WH2233> that it shall not<WH3808> be numbered<WH5608> for multitude.<WH4480> <WH7230>

And the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto her, Behold,<WH2009> thou art with child,<WH2030> and shalt bear<WH3205> a son,<WH1121> and shalt call<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Ishmael;<WH3458> because<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> hath heard<WH8085> <WH413> thy affliction.<WH6040>

And he<WH1931> will be<WH1961> a wild<WH6501> man;<WH120> his hand<WH3027> will be against every man,<WH3605> and every man's<WH3605> hand<WH3027> against him; and he shall dwell<WH7931> in the presence<WH5921> <WH6440> of all<WH3605> his brethren.<WH251>

And she called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068> that spoke<WH1696> unto<WH413> her, Thou<WH859> God<WH410> seest<WH7210> me: for<WH3588> she said,<WH559> Have I also<WH1571> here<WH1988> looked<WH7200> after<WH310> him that seeth<WH7200> me?
Wherefore <WH5921> <WH3651> the well<WH875> was called<WH7121> Beer-lahai-roi;<WH883> behold,<WH2009> it is between<WH996> Kadesh<WH6946> and Bered.<WH1260>
And Hagar<WH1904> bore<WH3205> Abram<WH87> a son:<WH1121> and Abram<WH87> called<WH7121> his son's<WH1121> name,<WH8034> which<WH834> Hagar<WH1904> bore,<WH3205> Ishmael.<WH3458>
And Abram<WH87> was fourscore<WH8084> and six<WH8337> years<WH8141> old,<WH1121> when Hagar<WH1904> bore<WH3205> <WH853> Ishmael<WH3458> to Abram.<WH87>
